title: Stuart Beavon (footballer, born 1958)
text:
Michael Stuart Beavon (born 30 November 1958 in <a href="Wolverhampton">Wolverhampton</a>, England) is an English former <a href="association%20football">footballer</a>.
Career.
Tottenham Hotspur.
Beavon started his <a href="association%20football">football</a> career as an apprentice with <a href="Tottenham%20Hotspur%20F.C.">Tottenham Hotspur</a>. He then joined the first-team squad in 1978, and spent time on loan at <a href="Notts%20County%20F.C.">Notts County</a> for the <a href="1979-80%20in%20English%20football">1979-80</a> season.<ref name="TOTTENHAM HOTSPUR : 1946/47 - 2005/06"></ref>
Reading.
Beavon joined <a href="Reading%20F.C.">Reading</a> in 1980. Here, he made a total of 396 league appearances, scoring 44 goals.<ref name="READING : 1946/47 - 2005/06"></ref>
Northampton Town.
Beavon joined <a href="Northampton%20Town%20F.C.">Northampton Town</a> in 1990. He made a total of 98 league appearances and 14 goals.<ref name="NORTHAMPTON TOWN : 1946/47 - 2005/06"></ref>
Newbury Town.
Beavon joined <a href="Newbury%20Town%20F.C.">Newbury Town</a> in 1993.
Personal life.
He is the son of the former late <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> <a href="Cyril%20Beavon">Cyril Beavon</a>. He is also the father of football player <a href="Stuart%20Beavon%20%28footballer%20born%201984%29">Stuart Beavon</a>.
He is now working as a Self-Employed Painter.
